intro: Dichromena longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved dichromena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in the spring and early summer. Dichromena longifolia is often found in the understory of forests and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
